title: Q3 FY2024 Financial Report Submission Deadline
message: Kenya Power and Lighting Company's Q3 FY2024 financial report is due for submission to the State Department for Energy by 15 November 2024. Please ensure the report is reviewed and signed off by the CFO and Board Audit Committee before submission.

title: Board Meeting — KPLC November 2024
message: The KPLC Board of Directors meeting scheduled for 20 November 2024 at Stima Plaza, Kolobot Road, Nairobi. Board papers to be circulated no later than 13 November 2024. Quorum requires at least 5 of 9 directors.

title: EPRA Tariff Review Response Required
message: EPRA has issued a request for additional information on KPLC's tariff review submission ref. EPRA/TRF/2024/001. Response required within 14 days of notice date (10 October 2024). Failure to respond may result in adverse determination.

title: KPA Interim Dividend — National Treasury Transfer Confirmed
message: KPA interim dividend payment of KES 2,050,000,000 for FY2023 has been successfully transferred to the National Treasury account on 15 December 2023. Receipt confirmed by National Treasury ref. NT/KPA/2023/INT/001.

title: Kenya Airways Government Directive — Cost Reduction Targets
message: Government Directive GD-KQ-2024-003 has been issued requiring Kenya Airways to achieve a 15% reduction in non-fuel operational costs by 31 December 2024. An implementation plan must be submitted to the State Department for Transport within 30 days.

title: KPA Annual Report Approved and Published
message: The KPA Annual Report and Financial Statements FY2023 has been approved by the Board on 28 October 2023 and is now published on the KPA website. The report shows record revenue of KES 40.5 billion and net profit of KES 8.2 billion.

title: Compliance Deadline — State Corporations Advisory Committee Returns
message: Annual SCAC performance returns for FY2023/24 are due by 30 September 2024. This includes Performance Contract evaluation forms, financial summaries, and board effectiveness self-assessment. Late submission attracts a penalty score.

title: Risk Register Update — KQ Fuel Hedging Position
message: The Risk Committee has flagged a critical risk: current fuel hedging coverage expires 31 December 2024 with no renewal in place. At current Jet A-1 prices, unhedged exposure represents a potential KES 1.8bn adverse variance. Immediate action required.

title: Investment Project Milestone — Berths 21-24 Construction Complete
message: KPA Berths 21-24 construction project has reached practical completion milestone on 15 August 2023, ahead of the scheduled completion date of 31 October 2023. Commissioning trials commence on 1 September 2023. Additional capacity of 500,000 TEUs per annum now available.

title: KPLC Audit Committee Meeting — External Auditor Appointment
message: The KPLC Audit Committee is scheduled to meet on 8 January 2024 to consider and approve the appointment of external auditors for FY2024. Three proposals have been received from PwC, KPMG, and Deloitte Kenya. Committee members should review proposals circulated on 2 January.

title: Kenya Airways Board Resolution — Fleet Disposal
message: Board Resolution KQ/BR/2023/015 requiring disposal of two Boeing 777-300ER aircraft (registration 5Y-KZD and 5Y-KZE) by 31 March 2024 has been passed. Asset disposal committee to initiate sales process immediately.

title: KPA Performance Contract Signing — FY2024/25
message: KPA Performance Contract for FY2024/25 has been signed between KPA Managing Director and the Cabinet Secretary, Ministry of Transport. Targets include 1.5 million TEU throughput, 95% equipment availability, and KES 42bn revenue. Contract effective from 1 July 2024.

title: KPLC Last Mile Connectivity Project — Phase III Disbursement Approval
message: World Bank has approved the Phase III disbursement of USD 150 million for the Last Mile Connectivity Project. Funds to be disbursed within 30 days. KPLC Finance to initiate counterpart funding contribution of KES 2.3bn in alignment.

title: Audit Finding — KQ Revenue Leakage Risk
message: Ernst & Young's FY2023 audit has identified a high-risk finding related to potential revenue leakage in code-share settlement reconciliation. Estimated exposure of KES 320m. Management response and remediation plan required within 45 days.

title: New Government Directive — SOE ESG Reporting Framework
message: The State Department for Public Service and Performance Management has issued Circular No. 2/2024 requiring all Tier 1 State Corporations to submit ESG (Environmental, Social and Governance) reports using the new standardised framework by 31 March 2025.

title: New Government Directive — SOE ESG Reporting Framework
message: The State Department for Public Service and Performance Management has issued Circular No. 2/2024 requiring all Tier 1 State Corporations to submit ESG reports using the new standardised framework by 31 March 2025.

title: New Government Directive — SOE ESG Reporting Framework
message: The State Department for Public Service and Performance Management has issued Circular No. 2/2024 requiring all Tier 1 State Corporations to submit ESG reports using the new standardised framework by 31 March 2025.

title: KPA Board Meeting — Dividend Declaration
message: KPA Board meeting scheduled for 31 October 2024 will include an agenda item on final dividend declaration for FY2024. Finance to prepare dividend computation and recommendation paper. National Treasury representative has confirmed attendance.

title: Workforce Restructuring Update — KQ Staff Reduction
message: Kenya Airways workforce restructuring programme has completed Phase 1, with 340 voluntary early retirement packages accepted. Phase 2 targeting an additional 200 reductions through redeployment and natural attrition is now underway. HR to update workforce metrics.

title: KPLC System Interruption — Revenue Management Risk
message: IT systems audit has identified that the Customer Information System (CIS) has not been patched since March 2023, creating a cybersecurity vulnerability. The CISO has escalated this as a high-priority risk requiring immediate remediation.

title: KPA Berths 25-26 Environmental Impact Assessment Approved
message: NEMA has approved the EIA for KPA Berths 25-26 construction project (NEMA/EIA/2024/118). Works can now commence subject to compliance with 12 conditions including mangrove replanting programme. Project start date confirmed as 1 February 2025.

title: Annual Governance Compliance Self-Assessment Due
message: The Mwongozo Code of Governance annual self-assessment for all three Tier 1 SOEs is due by 28 February 2025. The Centre for Corporate Governance (CCG) has sent the assessment toolkit. Company Secretaries should coordinate with respective board chairs to complete the process.

title: KQ Fleet Renewal — Board Approval Pending
message: The Kenya Airways Fleet Renewal Business Case for 12 Boeing 787-9 and 8 Embraer E2 aircraft has been reviewed by the Finance Committee and is ready for full Board consideration. The business case has been placed on the agenda for the special board meeting on 15 December 2024.

title: KPLC Power Outage Incident Report — Nairobi CBD
message: A major power interruption affecting Nairobi CBD, Westlands, and Upperhill from 06:30 to 14:15 on 3 October 2024 requires formal incident reporting to EPRA within 72 hours per EPRA Regulations 2012. Estimated customer impact: 420,000 customers, KES 85m commercial loss.

title: National Treasury Dividend Demand — FY2024 Interim
message: National Treasury has formally requested KPA's FY2024 interim dividend payment of not less than KES 2.2 billion by 20 December 2024, in line with the dividend policy requiring 50% of audited net profit to be paid to government. Finance team to process by due date.
